alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 14 at 6:19PM EDT until July 14 at 8:30PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHWESTERN MONTGOMERY COUNTY... At 619 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms had produced heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. The heavy rain has ended, but it will take some time for runoff to work down area streams. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Germantown... Gaithersburg... Lowes Island... Poolesville... North Potomac... Great Falls... Darnestown... Washington Grove... Dawsonville... FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
